name: Barbaric (itch)
description:
Published by Upopa Game, 2016.

Barbaric is a pinball hack and slash game. The player controls a barbarian who can curl into a ball and launch into enemies. The game is turn based: the player aims and shoots, then the enemies have a chance to strike back. I managed and directed the project, working mostly with one artist and one programmer.
I designed all 50 levels myself. I had a small story or scenario in mind for most of the levels: A skirmish in a village, fighting in tight castle corridors, pitched battle against a horde of enemies, etc. Without any text, I used environmental storytelling to give a sense of place: enemy types and placements, scenery, and layout.

Art and animation: Niv Touboul, Shachar Tzin, Gal Borensztajn
Programming: Or Avrahamy, Amir Blum
